messageBody:
I figured out my problem with JMock from my earlier post. I didn't
have all of the required libraries. 1st off I thought the
jmock-cglibxx.jar available on the jmock website was enough to enable
class mocking. I went back and re-read the docs and realized that this
Jar only contained the interfaces for cglib mock objects. I then found
downloaded CGLIB as directed by the docs on the jmock site and tried
again. Still I was getting NoClassDefFound errors pointing to the
org.objectweb.asm package. I immediately overreacted because we
recently switched from the objectweb JOnAS appserver to JBoss and I
assumed that the error meant that there was stray references to
objectweb stuff somewhere in our codebase. I started complaining to
the developers here that we need to do a better job of reducing these
hidden dependencies when I then realized that the error was
complaining about yet another required jar for class mocking. I had to
go and download the ASM jar to complete the task. After doing all of
this I updated my paths in Idea and re-ran my test to discover that
the class I was trying to mock was final and could not be subclassed.
What a poop on my dreams. Anyhow I just wanted to share my experience.
Rule of thumb, if you find the need to mock a class, rethink your
design. I know my design stinks, which is why I'm having so many problems.
